title: Better Emulate previous versions of IE!
body: Improve Emulation tool to accurately represent how the CSS is rendered in previous versions of IE.  People still use IE9-11, and they are all handle CSS in non-standard ways.

comments.body: Horrid idea! Is there a downvote option (I know there isn't)? If you want to test IE then use IE...it's still available. I really don't want that bloat added to Edge.
I strongly disagree with this. If you want to emulate IE, then debug and use IE.

I fundamentally disagree with this. I agree with Dan that we need to break away from the past and not worry about legacy browsers. If you need to develop to legacy browsers than use the VM's provided by Modern.ie and not rely on emulation.

Downvote. Backwards compatibility with non-standard implementations of web technology encourages the continued use of code that generally breaks web compatibility by developers, causes code bloat in the browser, and makes compatibility testing more complicated for web developers. Time and effort would be much better directed at actually implementing web standards (HTML5, CSS3, ES6).

IE 11 includes Enterprise Mode, which provides the solution you are looking for. This allows legacy web applications to still work using classic IE engines, but within the IE 11 security wall. http://love2dev.com/#!article/Should-You-Continue-To-Support-Internet-Explorer-8

I'd prefer multiple full installs on one machine - https://wpdev.uservoice.com/forums/257854-internet-explorer-platform/suggestions/6567769-allow-simultaneous-stand-alone-installations-of-d - as I don't really trust the emulations any more.
Oh yes please. Users simple don't want to upgrade, but if we have a 'proper' way to emulate previous versions of IE that would be 'magnific'!
